id: Advocates of Sex Assault Survivors Decry Transfer of NYPD’s Special Victims Chief
paragraph: November 15, 2018Advocates for survivors of sexual assault said they lost a strong ally and supporter when the New York Police Department removed the longtime head of the Special Victims Division last week.Deputy Chief Michael Osgood was transferred out of the post to a new assignment in Staten Island after NYPD brass concluded a seven-month review of the division. The review was prompted by the city’s Department of Investigation releasing a scathing report about the division in March.WSJ MembershipCustomer ServiceTools & FeaturesAdsMore
